casebody.data:
Bennie MILLER, Appellant,
v.
DUFF MAN'S 24HR TOWING AND RECOVERY, LLC and Terrance Stocking, Respondents. No. ED 106497 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. Filed: March 12, 2019
Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied April 16, 2019 ATTORNEYS FOR APPELLANT: John J. Pawloski, 1900 Locust Street, Suite 302, St. Louis, MO 63103. ATTORNEYS FOR RESPONDENT: Douglas O. McCloskey, 12015 Manchester Road, Suite 185, Des Peres, MO 63131. Before Philip M. Hess, P.J. and Robert G. Dowd, Jr. and Mary K. Hoff, JJ.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Bennie Miller appeals from the judgment entered in this court-tried case dismissing his rent-and-possession claim and granting Terrence Stocking's counterclaim for specific performance of an oral contract to purchase the property at issue. The judgment is not against the weight of the evidence and is supported by substantial evidence. No error of law appears. We affirm. Stocking's motion for attorney fees and costs is denied without prejudice.

An opinion would have no precedential value nor serve any jurisprudential purpose. The parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this order pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
